title: China tests crewed spacecraft abort and rocket recovery in major lunar milestone
summary:
China took a major step forward in its lunar and human spaceflight programs late Tuesday with successful in-flight abort and rocket recovery tests.
The post China tests crewed spacecraft abort and rocket recovery in major lunar milestone appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA marks International Day of Women and Girls in Science 2026
summary: Today we join the international community in celebrating Women and Girls in Science. Discover the diversity of female talents working in science and technology around Europe and the words of wisdom that shaped their careers.

title: Women and Girls in Science: Sharing wisdom, shaping the future
FCC approves thousands more Amazon Leo satellites as Gen 1 deadline looms
summary:
Amazon received approval Feb. 10 to deploy thousands more broadband satellites, weeks after seeking relief from a July milestone for its first-generation network after reaching only about 11% of the required deployment.
The post FCC approves thousands more Amazon Leo satellites as Gen 1 deadline looms appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Summer Heat Hits Southeastern Australia
summary: January brought blistering extremes Down Under as record temperatures scorched the nation’s southeast.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 24 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The Starlink 17-34 mission will be the 16th launch for SpaceX so far this year. Liftoff from pad 4E is scheduled for 6:14:40 a.m. PST (9:14:40 a.m. EST / 1414:40 UTC).

title: ULA sets sights on ramping up launch cadence in 2026
summary: The company came under new leadership in December following the departure of Tory Bruno, who left the company to join Blue Origin.

title: Satellite manufacturers see emerging market for ‘mini-constellations’
summary:
Manufacturers of small satellites that lack opportunities to build very large constellations say they are seeing growing interest from customers seeking smaller systems tailored to specific needs.
The post Satellite manufacturers see emerging market for ‘mini-constellations’ appeared first on SpaceNews.
